sprint_goal: Establish the core application shell, secure user authentication, and foundational user management capabilities. Ensure all secrets are stored securely and the background service is reliable.
Implement critical security and compliance features: a comprehensive audit trail, role-based access control, automatic session locking, and PHI redaction from logs.
Build the core DICOM network functionality, enabling the system to receive studies from modalities and allowing administrators to configure external PACS connections.
Deliver the primary clinical workflow: querying and retrieving studies from a remote PACS and providing a high-performance viewer for image manipulation and review.
Enhance the viewer with annotation and measurement tools, including saving them as DICOM-compliant Presentation States. Provide UI personalization options.
Implement the end-to-end printing workflow, from a rich print preview UI for job submission to a print queue for monitoring and managing the asynchronous processing.
Deliver advanced data management features, including safe metadata editing, data anonymization tools, and the ability to export layouts as secure PDFs.
Finalize the product for release by implementing the installer with prerequisite checks, license validation, system health monitoring, and critical error alerting.
